text: Yaquelin Abdala (born 1968) is a Cuban mixed media artist, working with traditional and physical media. == Exhibitions == Abdala displayed her brightly colored "faux" paintings, at the Fifth Havana Biennial (6 May – 30 June 1994).Universes in Universe – Pat Binder, Gerhard Haupt. "Havana Biennial."Havana Biennial. N.p., n.d. Web. 13 April 2017. The subject of the paintings was a combination of urban and rural Cuba, their mythologies, folk tales, and contrasts, featuring Abdala's personal anecdotes and dreams.Chadwick, Whitney. "Chapter 14: Worlds Together, Worlds Apart." Women, Art, and Society. 5th ed. 429. Print. Abdala has been featured in several prominent gallery shows, including the acclaimed exhibit "Kuba Ok", which had several pieces purchased and displayed by a patron in Germany.Caballero, Germán Rubiano, and Germán Rubiano Caballero. "Regions and Countries."Art of Latin America, 1981–2000. Washington, D.C.: Inter-American Development Bank, 2001. 31–32. Print. ==References== ==External links== * Homepage Category:Living people Category:1968 births Category:Cuban women artists Category:Mixed-media artists Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
title: Yaquelin Abdala
